about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: You are merging onto an interstate highway. You should:

about.name: You are merging onto an interstate highway. You should:

hasPart.assesses: You are merging onto an interstate highway. You should: | You are merging onto an interstate highway. You should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Anytime you want to merge with other drivers, you need to find a gap large enough for you to safely enter into the flow of traffic. You should not stop on the entrance ramp to an interstate highway unless there are no gaps into which you may safely merge.

suggestedAnswer.text: Select a safe gap and merge into the lane of traffic.

comment.text: Select a safe gap and merge into the lane of traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: Merge across two lanes at once.

comment.text: Merge across two lanes at once.

suggestedAnswer.text: Always stop before entering the highway.

comment.text: Always stop before entering the highway.

acceptedAnswer.text: Select a safe gap and merge into the lane of traffic.

comment.text: Select a safe gap and merge into the lane of traffic.

answerExplanation.text: Anytime you want to merge with other drivers, you need to find a gap large enough for you to safely enter into the flow of traffic. You should not stop on the entrance ramp to an interstate highway unless there are no gaps into which you may safely merge.

comment.text: You are merging onto an interstate highway. You should: | Anytime you want to merge with other drivers, you need to find a gap large enough for you to safely enter into the flow of traffic. You should not stop on the entrance ramp to an interstate highway unless there are no gaps into which you may safely merge.

hasPart.name: When can you drive in a bike lane?

about.name: When can you drive in a bike lane?

hasPart.assesses: When can you drive in a bike lane? | When can you drive in a bike lane? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When you are making a right turn, you must enter the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner or driveway entrance. Do not drive in the bicycle lane at any other time

suggestedAnswer.text: 30 minutes after sunset or 30 minutes before sunrise

comment.text: 30 minutes after sunset or 30 minutes before sunrise

suggestedAnswer.text: On foggy days when visibility is low

comment.text: On foggy days when visibility is low
200 feet before making a turn
200 feet before making a turn

answerExplanation.text: When you are making a right turn, you must enter the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner or driveway entrance. Do not drive in the bicycle lane at any other time

comment.text: When can you drive in a bike lane? | When you are making a right turn, you must enter the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner or driveway entrance. Do not drive in the bicycle lane at any other time

hasPart.name: Blocking an intersection during "rush hour" traffic is not permitted:

about.name: Blocking an intersection during "rush hour" traffic is not permitted:

hasPart.assesses: Blocking an intersection during "rush hour" traffic is not permitted: | Blocking an intersection during "rush hour" traffic is not permitted: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Even if your light is green, you should not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across before the light turns red. You can be cited if you block the intersection.

suggestedAnswer.text: Unless you entered the intersection on a green light.

comment.text: Unless you entered the intersection on a green light.

suggestedAnswer.text: Under any circumstances, even if your light is green.

comment.text: Under any circumstances, even if your light is green.

suggestedAnswer.text: Unless you have the right-of-way or a green light.

comment.text: Unless you have the right-of-way or a green light.

acceptedAnswer.text: Under any circumstances, even if your light is green.

comment.text: Under any circumstances, even if your light is green.

answerExplanation.text: Even if your light is green, you should not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across before the light turns red. You can be cited if you block the intersection.

comment.text: Blocking an intersection during "rush hour" traffic is not permitted: | Even if your light is green, you should not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across before the light turns red. You can be cited if you block the intersection.

hasPart.name: If you are involved in a traffic collision, you are required to complete and submit a written report to the DMV:

about.name: If you are involved in a traffic collision, you are required to complete and submit a written report to the DMV:

hasPart.assesses: If you are involved in a traffic collision, you are required to complete and submit a written report to the DMV: | If you are involved in a traffic collision, you are required to complete and submit a written report to the DMV: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If a collision results in death, any minor or major injury, or more than $1,000 in damage to anyone's property, each driver involved must file a report with the DMV within 10 days. In some cases, the driver's insurance agent, broker, or legal representative may file the report to represent the driver.

suggestedAnswer.text: Only if you or the other driver is injured.

comment.text: Only if you or the other driver is injured.

suggestedAnswer.text: If there is property damage in excess of $1,000 or if there are any injuries.

comment.text: If there is property damage in excess of $1,000 or if there are any injuries.

suggestedAnswer.text: Only if you are at fault.

comment.text: Only if you are at fault.

acceptedAnswer.text: If there is property damage in excess of $1,000 or if there are any injuries.

comment.text: If there is property damage in excess of $1,000 or if there are any injuries.

answerExplanation.text: If a collision results in death, any minor or major injury, or more than $1,000 in damage to anyone's property, each driver involved must file a report with the DMV within 10 days. In some cases, the driver's insurance agent, broker, or legal representative may file the report to represent the driver.

comment.text: If you are involved in a traffic collision, you are required to complete and submit a written report to the DMV: | If a collision results in death, any minor or major injury, or more than $1,000 in damage to anyone's property, each driver involved must file a report with the DMV within 10 days. In some cases, the driver's insurance agent, broker, or legal representative may file the report to represent the driver.

hasPart.name: You must obey instructions from school crossing guards:

about.name: You must obey instructions from school crossing guards:

hasPart.assesses: You must obey instructions from school crossing guards: | You must obey instructions from school crossing guards: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Drivers should be alert to the presence of crossing guards when near a school and must always obey their instructions.

comment.text: At all times.
Only during school hours.

suggestedAnswer.text: Unless you do not see any children present.

comment.text: Unless you do not see any children present.
At all times.

answerExplanation.text: Drivers should be alert to the presence of crossing guards when near a school and must always obey their instructions.

hasPart.name: Two sets of solid double yellow lines that are two or more feet apart:

about.name: Two sets of solid double yellow lines that are two or more feet apart:

hasPart.assesses: Two sets of solid double yellow lines that are two or more feet apart: | Two sets of solid double yellow lines that are two or more feet apart: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Two sets of solid double yellow lines spaced two or more feet apart are considered a barrier. You may not drive on or over this barrier, or make a left turn or U-turn across it, except at designated openings.

suggestedAnswer.text: May be crossed to enter or exit a private driveway.

comment.text: May be crossed to enter or exit a private driveway.

suggestedAnswer.text: May not be crossed for any reason.

comment.text: May not be crossed for any reason.

suggestedAnswer.text: Should be treated as a separate traffic lane.

comment.text: Should be treated as a separate traffic lane.

acceptedAnswer.text: May not be crossed for any reason.

comment.text: May not be crossed for any reason.

answerExplanation.text: Two sets of solid double yellow lines spaced two or more feet apart are considered a barrier. You may not drive on or over this barrier, or make a left turn or U-turn across it, except at designated openings.

comment.text: Two sets of solid double yellow lines that are two or more feet apart: | Two sets of solid double yellow lines spaced two or more feet apart are considered a barrier. You may not drive on or over this barrier, or make a left turn or U-turn across it, except at designated openings.
